portal_hypertension.title: Same Session Validation of a Custom-Built 22G With the Commercial 25G System for EUS-Guided Portal Pressure Gradient Measurement.
portal_hypertension.authors: Praktiknjo M, Farouk N, Wang Z
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于临床研究（样本量约为 26）。核心观点：内镜超声引导门静脉压力梯度 (EUS-PPG) 测量是肝静脉压力梯度 (HVPG) 评估的一种有前途的替代方案，特别是在 HVPG 不可用或有限的情况下。 临床提示：商用 25 号 (25G) 系统与肝静脉压力梯度 (HVPG) 具有良好的相关性。
portal_hypertension.abstract: Endoscopic ultrasound-guided portal pressure gradient (EUS-PPG) measurement is a promising alternative to hepatic venous pressure gradient (HVPG) assessment, especially in settings where HVPG is unavailable or limited. The commercial 25-gauge (25G) system showed good correlation with the hepatic venous pressure gradient (HVPG). However, the 25G has drawbacks due to its small caliber and the proprietary pressure transducer. The aim of this study was to validate a custom-built 22G conventional intravascular pressure transducer system (22G EUS-PPG). portal_hypertension.abstract: Chronic liver congestion progresses to liver fibrosis, eventually leading to cirrhosis and cancer. This study aimed to elucidate the mechanism of congestive hepatopathy (CH), focusing on liver sinusoidal endothelial cells (LSECs). Partial inferior vena cava ligation (pIVCL) was performed to induce hepatic congestion in mice. Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) was conducted on murine livers after pIVCL. Cells underwent hydrostatic pressure stimulation. scRNA-seq and spatial transcriptomics were performed on human livers from patients with Fontan-associated liver disease.
